hackathon-apr-2024.registrationHookText: Join the BrAPI community for a week of fun as we hack code together and discuss the future of BrAPI. This event will be April 15-19, 2024 in Wittenberg, Germany. Everyone in the BrAPI community is welcome! Please register to receive meeting invitations and other important information.
hackathon-apr-2024.overviewText: The BrAPI Community Hackathon is an event focused on bringing together the BrAPI community. This weeklong event will reserve time for the members of the community to discuss the BrAPI specification, collaborate on projects, socialize and learn from each other. The hackathon is largely self-organizing project work time, with a few scheduled public discussion sessions addressing important community topics. The overall goal is to be as productive as possible in a small window of time, to explore ideas and start on collaborative projects that can be more formally developed after the event.
hackathon-apr-2024.additionalText:
Registration

Registration for this event is required for ALL attendees. If you are even considering attending, please register as soon as possible. Last minute cancellations are much preferred over last minute additions. This helps the organizers get an accurate attendees count for the event as early as possible.

Question: Should I still register if I plan on attending remotely?
Yes! One of the options on the registration form is used to indicate whether or not you will be participating in-person. Remote attendees still need to register so we can contact you about the hackathon, know what projects or teams you are working on, and know which discussion topics you are most interested in.

Question: What if I don't know yet if I will be attending in-person or remotely?
If you don't know yet if you will be in-person, there is an option in the registration form for exactly that scenario. If you register with the "I Don't Know Yet" option selected, an organizer will follow-up with you later to confirm. Event organizers can also work with you directly to help resolve any issues that might be keeping you from attending in-person.


Travel Grants

There are a small number of travel grants available to help those who would not be able to travel otherwise. Again, as part of the registration form, there is an option to request "travel support". As soon as you register with a request for travel support, an event organizer will contact you directly and help you through the necessary steps to apply for a travel grant.

Question: Who can apply for a travel grant?
Anyone in the BrAPI community can apply for a travel grant. There is a tentative restriction on multiple people from the same organization being awarded travel money. This is to try to even spread the money to as many organizations as possible, and can be overridden if there is a good reason.

hackathon-oct-2023.registrationHookText: Join the BrAPI community for a week of fun as we hack code together and discuss the future of BrAPI. This virtual event will be October 23-27, 2023. Everyone in the BrAPI community is welcome! Please register to receive meeting invitations and other important information.
hackathon-oct-2023.overviewText:
The BrAPI Community Hackathon is an event focused on bringing together the BrAPI community. This weeklong event will reserve time for the members of the community to discuss the BrAPI specification, collaborate on projects, socialize and learn from each other. The hackathon is largely self-organizing project work time, with a few scheduled public discussion sessions addressing important community topics. The overall goal is to be as productive as possible in a small window of time, to explore ideas and start on collaborative projects that can be more formally developed after the event.

One major take away from the past virtual hackathons was that attendees were feeling distracted by other work. If you can, try to reserve the whole week in your schedule so normal work does not intrude on the project work time. Of course, deadlines and emergencies happen, and BrAPI will not always be the top priority. This is just a reminder that you will get more out of the virtual hackathon experience if you can dedicate the time to focus on it.

projects.title: BrAPI-R
projects.description: I'm working on a set of modular R Shiny apps that use BrAPI via the brapiR-v1 R package for interactive breeding data analyses (the goal is for these to be especially tinkerable, so breeders can modify them themselves for miscellaneous analyses that aren't covered in breedbase instances). I'm interested in integrating new BrAPI features (working with any brapiR developers if they're present), along with improving performance and adding better documentation for GitHub.

hackathon-oct-2022.registrationHookText: Join the BrAPI community for a week of fun as we hack code together and discuss the future of BrAPI. This virtual event will run from October 24-28, 2022. Everyone in the BrAPI community is welcome! Please register to receive meeting invitations and other important information.
hackathon-oct-2022.overviewText:
The BrAPI Community Hackathon is an event focused on bringing together the BrAPI community. This weeklong event will reserve time for the members of the community to discuss the BrAPI specification, collaborate on projects, socialize and learn from each other. The hackathon is largely self-organizing project work time, with a few scheduled public discussion sessions addressing important community topics. The overall goal is to be as productive as possible in a small window of time, to explore ideas and start on collaborative projects that can be more formally developed after the event.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it is not possible to bring everyone together in person, so the BrAPI Hackathons have gone virtual. Based on the feedback from the first virtual hackathon in March, the ideal plan would be a mix of virtual and in-person events, when international travel becomes possible again. For now, expect virtual BrAPI hackathons every 6 months to maintain momentum and growth of the community.

One major take away from the past virtual hackathons was that attendees were feeling distracted by other work. If you can, try to reserve the whole week in your schedule so normal work does not intrude on the project work time. Of course, deadlines and emergencies happen, and BrAPI will not always be the top priority. This is just a reminder that you will get more out of the virtual hackathon experience if you can dedicate the time to focus on it.

projects.title: U of Manitoba BrAPI Implementation
projects.description: Integration of BRAPI in university bioinformatics system

projects.title: Enhance QBMS R Package
projects.description: QBMS R package is used to Query the Breeding Management System(s) like BMS, BreeBase, and GIGWA (using BrAPI calls) and retrieve phenotypic and genotypic data directly into any analyzing pipeline developed in R statistical environment. During the hackathon, we will implement several tactics like cache requests, async calls and pagination, preventing abuse (e.g., DDoS filtering) by setting a rate-limit, use BrAPI v2.1 '/search/allelematrix' endpoint, etc.
projects.needs: Interested collaborators from BMS, BreedBase, and GIGWA.

The BrAPI Community Hackathon is an event focused on bringing together the BrAPI community. This weeklong event will reserve time for the members of the community to discuss the BrAPI specification, collaborate on projects, socialize and learn from each other. The hackathon is largely self-organizing project work time, with a few scheduled public discussion sessions addressing important community topics. The overall goal is to be as productive as possible in a small window of time, to explore ideas and start on collaborative projects that can be more formally developed after the event.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it is not possible to bring everyone together in person, so the BrAPI Hackathons have gone virtual. Based on the feedback from the first virtual hackathon in March, the ideal plan would be a mix of virtual and in-person events, when international travel becomes possible again. For now, expect virtual BrAPI hackathons every 6 months to maintain momentum and growth of the community.

One major take away from the past virtual hackathons was that attendees were feeling distracted by other work. If you can, try to reserve the whole week in your schedule so normal work does not intrude on the project work time. Of course, deadlines and emergencies happen, and BrAPI will not always be the top priority. This is just a reminder that you will get more out of the virtual hackathon experience if you can dedicate the time to focus on it.

hackathon-oct-2021.registrationHookText: Join the BrAPI community for two weeks of fun as we hack code together and discuss the future of BrAPI. This virtual event will run from Oct 4 - 8, 2021. Everyone in the BrAPI community is welcome! Please register to receive meeting invitations and other important information.
hackathon-oct-2021.overviewText:
The BrAPI Community Hackathon is an event focused on bringing together the BrAPI community. This weeklong event will reserve time for the members of the community to discuss the BrAPI specification, collaborate on projects, socialize and learn from each other. The hackathon is largely self-organizing project work time, with a few scheduled public discussion sessions addressing important community topics. The overall goal is to be as productive as possible in a small window of time, to explore ideas and start on collaborative projects that can be more formally developed after the event.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it is not possible to bring everyone together in person, so the BrAPI Hackathons have gone virtual. Based on the feedback from the first virtual hackathon in March, the ideal plan would be a mix of virtual and in-person events, when international travel becomes possible again. For now, expect virtual BrAPI hackathons every 6 months to maintain momentum and growth of the community.

One major take away from the last virtual hackathon was that attendees were feeling distracted by other work. If you can, try to reserve the whole week in your schedule so normal work does not intrude on the project work time. Of course, deadlines and emergencies happen, and BrAPI will not always be the top priority. This is just a reminder that you will get more out of the virtual hackathon experience if you can dedicate the time to focus on it.

projects.title: PhenoLib and Android Account Manager
projects.description: PhenoLib and Android Account Manager

projects.title: PhenoApps integration
projects.description: PhenoApps integration, creating general Android service and moving it to a library, creating a Room persistence database using OpenAPI for use in Android

projects.title: QBMS R Package
projects.description: QBMS R Package from ICARDA

projects.title: BRAPP: Command Line Tool
projects.description: A BrAPI-compliant command-line tool for uploading, viewing, and editing breeding data. Written in python. This application connects with an instance of the BrAPI V2 Test Server that is hosted in Google Cloud.

projects.title: TERRA REF v2 Implementation
projects.description: Implementing BrAPI v2 in the TERRA REF project server

projects.title: BrAPI to ARDN
projects.description: Using BrAPI data for crop modeling by converting BrAPI data to the ARDN format

projects.title: Trial Design Tool (R Shiny)
projects.description: Considering working on an R shiny trial design tool that can pull germplasm names, locations, etc from a BrAPI db and then post a completed design

projects.title: PIPPA v2 Implementation
projects.description: Adding support for BrAPI v2.0 to our phenotyping platform PIPPA
projects.needs: Looking for people with experience on adding BrAPI 2.0 to their database

projects.title: FEM BrAPI Implementation
projects.description: Integrate our database with BrAPI

projects.title: BRAPP: brapi-sync
projects.description: Improve brapi-sync app

projects.title: BRAPP: brapi-fieldmap
projects.description: Improve brapi-fieldmap app

projects.title: Crop Ontology v2 Implementation
projects.description: We are moving Crop Ontology to a new system. I am will be implementing the version 2 of the BRAPI calls that are relevant to the CO website.

projects.team: Marie-Angélique Laporte, Carlos Quiros Campos, Brandon Madriz Araya
projects.title: Germplasm data exchange with ClimMob
projects.description: It would be great to see how germplasm information can be exchanged from the Breedbase/BMS to ClimMob as a first step to provide on farm experiment information back to breeders
projects.needs: If some people from BMS and/or Breedbase are interested and available, that would be great

projects.title: BrAPI R
projects.description: Continue work on the BrAPI R package

projects.title: PHG BrAPI Implementation
projects.description: Continue building the BrAPI server infrastructure for the Practical Haplotype Graphs (PHG) project

projects.title: PUT Genotyping Data
projects.description: Develop new data structures and endpoints to allow for the submission of new genotype data to a server.

projects.team: Vishnu Govindaraj, Lynn Johnson, Zack Miller
projects.title: Continue Work on the Genotype Matrix Endpoint
projects.description: Planning to implement endpoints for Brapi genotype matrix extract in GDM. Existing one dimensional genotype extract has limitations like not scaling well for large genotype matrices. Also, representing genotypes as single object results in redundant fields with keys and identifiers producing very large response object size. By having a matrix(2 dimensional) extraction, we can resolve those issues and help improve performance of BrAPI clients to large extant.

projects.title: Field Book Stability Improvements
projects.description: Field Book stability improvements

projects.title: BrAPI Python Development Resources
projects.description: Collection of BrAPI v2.0 compliant stubs and data models for Python. The aim is to have a useful baseline to start (or add) BrAPI to a Python project and to continue work on a basic BrAPI Python Client.
